intro: Hieracium vulgatum var. irriguum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are covered in fine pubescence. This variety is known for its rapid spread and is considered a weed in some agricultural and horticultural contexts.
